segments.text: The kitchen looks so homey with the window letting in light.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the overflowing sink makes me worry about the damage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water ruining the cabinets and floor; it's heartbreaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so engrossed in her dish drying she misses it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children sneaking cookies might end in tears if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool doesn't look safe at all for the boy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl waiting eagerly adds to the innocence of it, but still risky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel sorry for the potential accident about to unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside seems like a safe haven in contrast.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes piled up, towel in handâ€”such a normal moment turned hazardous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Hopefully, they all stay safe in this mishap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The curtains tied back frame the peaceful view nicely.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a shame no one's noticing the dangers right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar full, tempting the kids despite the rules.
segments.speaker: PAR
